title: RFC Series Begins
overview: The Request for Comments (RFC) series launches as the open publication venue for Internet protocols and processes, establishing a transparent, vendor-neutral record for technical governance.

title: INWG Forms (Early Governance)
overview: The International Network Working Group (INWG) convenes researchers to coordinate packet networking ideas across projects — a precursor to later Internet governance bodies.

title: Internet Architecture Board (IAB)
overview: The IAB is established to provide architectural oversight for the Internet, stewarding the evolution of the protocol suite and advising on long-term design.

title: Internet Engineering Task Force (IETF)
overview: The IETF forms as an open, volunteer standards body where working groups specify Internet protocols through the RFC process — the de facto engine of Internet standardization.

title: IANA Functions Formalized
overview: The Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA) functions are formalized, coordinating IP addressing, protocol parameters, and the DNS root — foundational stewardship for a single, global Internet.

title: Internet Society (ISOC)
overview: ISOC is established to provide organizational home and advocacy for the Internet community, supporting the open development of standards (incl. IETF/IAB) and education worldwide.

title: ICANN Created; IANA Functions Transitioned
overview: The Internet Corporation for Assigned Names and Numbers (ICANN) is formed to coordinate DNS, IP address allocation policy interfaces, and protocol parameter registries with the community.

title: ICANN Bylaws & GAC
overview: ICANN governance matures with bylaws and the Governmental Advisory Committee (GAC), formalizing multi-stakeholder input including governments, private sector, and civil society.

title: Number Resource Organization (NRO)
overview: The NRO is formed by the Regional Internet Registries (RIRs) to coordinate global number resource policy and to serve as the Address Supporting Organization (ASO) within ICANN.

title: WSIS & Internet Governance Forum (IGF) Process
overview: Global policy forums (WSIS/IGF) emerge to debate Internet governance principles — openness, interoperability, and multi-stakeholderism — shaping expectations for the IPv4/IPv6 era.

title: IANA Stewardship Transition Announced
overview: The transition of IANA stewardship away from U.S. NTIA oversight to the global multi-stakeholder community is initiated, emphasizing accountability and transparency.

title: IANA Stewardship Transition Completed
overview: Stewardship of the IANA functions formally transitions to the community via ICANN, marking a landmark in global, multi-stakeholder Internet governance.
